Description.description: A gift transaction can be a one-time payment or a recurring payment (ie, monthly/sustainer giving). In addition, it can be a pledge (ie, promise) of a future payment or a current/received payment.
This is the amount (typically dollar value although this application is capable of multiple currencies) of the membership amount being paid today.
Value of the Amount (Membership) in base currency.
The non-receiptable portion of the total header amount
Value of the Amount (Non-Receiptable) in base currency.
This is the amount (typically dollar value although this application is capable of multiple currencies) of the donation.
Value of the Amount (Receiptable) in base currency.
The amount of tax attributed towards this transaction record, used when combining memberships or products in transactions
Value of the Amount (Tax) in base currency.
The total Amount of Failures
Value of the Amount of Failures in base currency.
When set to “TRUE” the donation record is set to “Anonymous” and should not appear in any related reports or marketing lists however is still related to a constituent or organization
The appeal this transaction is related to. The appeal is filtered by the campaign . event record. Only appeals that are assigned to the campaign /event in question can be used.
The details of the appraiser or appraisal, this is shown only when a user selects “In-kind”, “Gift”, “Stock” or “Property”.
Set the gateway processor, you can integrate with only one payment processor from the list provided.
The Country of the billing address, defaulted from the contact or account selected.
The first line of the receipt-able address, defaulted from the constituent or organization selected.
The second line of the receipt-able address, defaulted from the constituent or organization selected.
The third line of the receipt-able address, defaulted from the constituent or organization selected.
The postal code line of the receipt-able address, defaulted from the constituent or organization selected.
The province line of the receipt-able address, defaulted from the constituent or organization selected.
The date and time attribute that is defaulted to today’s date however can be overridden to record either a postdated donation, a donation that is yet to occur and previous dates.
If the recurring donation or pledge schedule has been cancelled, this attribute is needed to contain the reason.
A free text attribute that holds the cancellation information
The date the cancellation reason was updated \ inserted.
The credit card used from the parent Registration Package
When set to true (default) the process will charge the credit card payment method on file. This supports import of historical data.
When set to true (default) the process will charge the credit card payment method on file. This supports import of historical data.
A marker that prompts the system to charge the record upon first completion of the payment schedule
The Configuration record used to manage any settings and business logic for this transaction record.
The constituent record that will be used for any reporting. Typically, this only contains a value if the mcrm_customerid is an account.
The related constituent or organization that the transaction is related to
The unique receipt identifier as provided by the import process or source.
The source of the gift, typically this will either be in person, phone, mail or online and the user can select in person, phone or mail when creating a donation manually.
The Deposit date of the Cheque or Wire Transfer
The Primary designation for this record
The primary email address, defaulted from the contact or account selected.
The date of which the recurring donation, donation schedule or pledge schedule ends.
This is a relationship to the event that this product fulfillment relates to.
The related event package if this donation has been processed as part of the event purchase process
The First name of the Donor, defaulted to the value in the 'Donor' attribute.
iCal compliant recurrence field
iCal compliant recurrence field
iCal compliant recurrence field
The start on day that this recurring donation will observe. For example, 15, 1, 30 is when the funds will be processed.
How the declaration has been or is being delivered to the donor.
This is a lookup to a related transaction batch and denotes that this was created in bulk.
This is the unique, system generated invoice number that may appear on your payment gateway against its related posted transaction.
The last name of the Donor, defaulted to the value in the 'Donor' attribute.
The related membership category a user selected, this will drive the subsequent creation of the membership Instance
The Membership Instance created based on the selected 'Membership Category' record.
The mobile phone of the donor
The friendly unique name of this payment schedule record
The number of Concurrent Failures for this payment schedule
The number of successes per recurring donation record
The Organization Name related to the donor (if the donor is a constituent record).
This is a relationship to the campaign that this product fulfillment relates to.
The package this transaction is related to. The package is filtered by the appeal record. Only packages that are assigned to the appeal in question can be used.
The lookup to the payment method used for this payment schedule, this can be a credit card, bank account or alternate payment method.
The related payment processor for this payment schedule.
The type of transaction that the donation or pledge represents, typically this will be Cash, Credit\Debit Card or Cheque however also covers In Kind and Other
The receipt preference that is defaulted from the account or contact but can be modified or set at the transaction level.
The type of payment schedule, currently the types consist of 'Pledge Schedule' or 'Recurring Donation'
Either true or false and sets whether this record is a solicitor either third party or other
The related receipt record that represents the receipt number and information for this gift.
The primary phone number, defaulted from the constituent or organization selected in the donor attribute.
The secondary or alternate telephone number for the donor.
The balance remaining on this payment schedule if it relates to a pledge
Value of the Total Amount Balance in base currency.
The total amount paid for this payment schedule
Value of the Total Amount Paid in base currency.
The total amount that has been written off from the payment schedule if it relates to a pledge
Value of the Total Amount Written Off in base currency.
The description of the gift, this is mandatory when a user selects “In-kind”, “Gift”, “Stock” or “Property”.
The tokenized result of the Fraud code, typically this will be the results of the related AVS information (Address Verification Service)
The tokenized identifier information returned form the respective payment gateway
The tokenized result information returned form the respective payment gateway

displayname.description: Tribute or In Memory Of Email

Description.description: The email for this Tribute or In Memory Of message and acknowledgement
The option set value for this record

displayname.description: Tribute or In Memory Of Message

Description.description: The message for this Tribute or In Memory Of
Status of the Payment Schedule
Status of the Payment Schedule
Reason for the status of the Payment Schedule
Reason for the status of the Payment Schedule
